game

Class DoublePosition

  • java.lang.Object
    • game.DoublePosition

  • public class DoublePosition
extends java.lang.Object
    A class representing a location on the soccer field, with x and y coordinates (double numbers).

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static double EPSILON
      This value is used to determined via equals(Object) if the double values of x and y are almost and enough equal.

      double realY
      y coordinate (real numbers)

    • Field Detail

      • realX

      • realY

        y coordinate (real numbers)

      • EPSILON

        public static final double EPSILON
        This value is used to determined via equals(Object) if the double values of x and y are almost and enough equal. For more strict equalities, EPSILON must be smaller, and for more flexible comparisons it should be greater. We have determined is as 1.0E-6.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • toIntFloorPosition

        public Position toIntFloorPosition()
        Returns:
        obtains a transformation to an object of type Position where the coordinates x and y are the largest previous integer values (floor) of realX and realY.

      • toIntCeilingPosition

        public Position toIntCeilingPosition()
        Returns:
        obtains a transformation to an object of type Position where the coordinates x and y <\strong> are the smallest following integer values (ceiling) of realX and realY.

      • toIntRoundPosition

        public Position toIntRoundPosition()
        Returns:
        obtains a transformation to an object of type Position where the coordinates x and y <\strong> are the nearest integer values (round) of realX and realY.
